items.title: Agri Picks Report May 15, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The area under summer crops across India was at 7.88 million hectares as of Friday, up nearly 10% from 7.19 million hectares a year ago, according to data released by the agriculture ministry on Wednesday.

items.title: Berger Paints Q4: Gaining market share despite emerging competition
items.description: Outperforming industry growth amid challenging market conditions

items.title: GAIL: A better transmission volume remains the biggest bet
items.description: The company is expected to capitalise on the growing natural gas consumption demand

items.title: Live: Nifty bounces off lows, but is 25,000 the next stop? | Opening Bell
items.description: Markets largely ended in the green with continued buying in the broader segments, led by the Nifty Midcap index which outperformed the benchmarks. Defence stocks saw sustained interest, rising up to 15%, while India VIX cooled off further, dropping 5%. However, Bank Nifty slipped 150 points to close at 54,801. On the earnings front, LIC Housing and JSW Energy are set to announce their Q4 results today, while Eicher Motors and Tata Power are expected to react to their recently reported numbers. This morning, global cues were largely lower. US markets ended mixed overnight while Asia-Pacific markets started the day largely lower. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets (Technical) and Kush Gupta, Director at SKG Investment & Advisory.

items.title: Growth outlook dims for room AC makers
items.description: Pre-monsoon showers and the soft summer season have weighed on sales so far in Q1 FY26

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Eicher Motors, Apollo Tyres, Lupin, Wendt India, HUL, Brigade, Genesys, Wipro, Shilpa Medicare, Yes Bank, Vascon Engineers in focus on 15 May
items.description: Stocks to Watch, 15 May: Stocks like Wendt India, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever, Brigade Enterprises, Genesys International Corporation, Wipro, Shilpa Medicare, Kirloskar Brothers, State Bank of India, Yes Bank, Gensol Engineering, Allcargo Logistics, Edelweiss Financial Services, Max Healthcare Institute, Navin Fluorine International, and Waaree Energies will be in focus on May 15.

items.title: Brigade Enterprises acquires land in Chennai, announces Q4 results; stock trades lower
items.description: Brigade Enterprises Share Price | The company's Q4FY25 net profit jumped 19.7 percent to Rs 246.82 crore from Rs 206.09 crore in the same quarter of previous year.

items.title: Shilpa Medicare shares rise 3% on EIR from USFDA
items.description: Shilpa Medicare Share Price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 959.95 and a 52-week low of Rs 419.10 on 18 September, 2024 and 04 June, 2024, respectively.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Nifty around 24,500, Sensex slips 500 pts; Power Grid, NTPC, Kotak Bank top losers
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Among sectors, except auto, media, metal, all other indices are trading in the red. BSE Midcap index up 0.3 percent and smallcap index up 0.6 percent. JSW Steel, Hero MotoCorp, Tata Motors, Shriram Finance, Adani Ports are among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers are ONGC, Dr Reddy's Lab, Power Grid Corp, Kotak Mahindra Banka and NTPC.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) bought equities worth Rs 931 crore on May 14, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) purchased equities of Rs 316 crore on the same day.

items.title: Bulk & Block deals: CLSA Global Markets Fund sold 1.2% stake in Edelweiss Financial Services
items.description: In Info Edge, Citigroup Global Markets Mauritius Pvt Ltd bought 2,12,700 shares at Rs 1,464.5 apiece

items.title: Hero MotoCorp shares rise as strong Q4, rural demand and EV plans boost sentiment
items.description: India’s largest two-wheeler maker is aiming to outpace the industry’s projected 6–7 percent growth this fiscal, buoyed by robust rural demand, signs of recovery in the entry-level segment, and fresh momentum in the 125cc motorcycle lineup.

items.title: Jubilant Foodworks: India business outlook strong; valuation expensive
items.description: While India business outlook is robust, DP Eurasia (mainly Turkey business) is currently facing macroeconomic challenges, owing to hyper inflation

items.title: Which bag to pack for your investment journey?
items.description: Luggage sector saw a difficult going in FY25, can things change for the better?

items.title: Tata Power to bid for UP discoms to expand T&D presence, plans Rs 25,000 crore capex this fiscal
items.description: Tata Power intends to bid for two discoms in Uttar Pradesh under its broader strategy to grow its transmission and distribution (T&D) business.

items.title: SME IPO merchant bankers under SEBI scanner for malpractices, violations of rules
items.description: On Wednesday, SEBI passed an interim order wherein Inventure Merchant Banking Services was directed not to take new merchant banking assignment until further orders. SEBI has taken similar action against First Overseas Capital as well.

items.title: Auto stocks soar on hope of progress in US trade deal with Here Moto, Tata Motors topping the chart
items.description: The surge in auto stocks comes amid a broader rally, with benchmark indices Sensex over 1,200 points and Nifty 50 closing above 25,000 at seven-month highs.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty at seven-month high as mid-day buying takes index past 25,000
items.description: An intra-day surge saw Nifty 50 index rise to hit its highest level in seven months, taking it past the 25,000 mark on a day of across-the-board buying.

items.title: Live: Nifty breaches 25,100 for the first time since Oct 2024 | Closing Bell
items.description: Market Extends Gain To Second Day. Sensex, Nifty Surge Over 1(%). Nifty Above 25,000 After 141 Sessions. Nifty Above 25,100 After Seven Months. All Sectors End In The Positive Zone. Nifty Auto, Realty, Metal Top Performers. India Vix Continues To Cool Off, Down 2(%). Nifty 50 Gainers: Hero Moto, Jsw Steel, Tata Motors. Nifty 50 Losers: Indusind Bank. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Bank Nifty over a percent higher, snaps two-day losing streak on rate cut hopes and tariff updates
items.description: Banking shares rallied in-line with the sentiment in the broader market, after latest inflation data raised optimism for potential RBI rate cuts, and easing US-China trade tensions offered respite from global recession fears.

items.title: NSE shareholder base crosses 1 lakh-mark as it still awaits IPO nod
items.description: NSE filed its IPO prospectus in December 2016. Shares of the exchange are one of the most actively traded in the unlisted space

items.title: Wendt India shares tumble 15% on parent's OFS plans, Genesys down 6% on QIP to raise Rs 110 crore
items.description: Wendt India announced that German promoter Wendt GmbH plans to sell its entire 37.5 percent stake in the company via the OFS.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp enjoys a smooth ride in FY25
items.description: The company sees a surge in demand, particularly in rural areas
